Small amounts of whatever 
you are eating and drinking 
can pass to your baby through 
your breastmilk, so itâ€™s a good 
idea to think about how much 
alcohol	and	caffeine	you	are	
having.	These	may	affect	your	
baby in the same way they 
affect	you.
If you think a food or foods 
that you are eating are 
affecting	your	baby,	talk	to	
your GP or health visitor, 
or contact the National 
Breastfeeding Helpline on 
0300 100 0212.
